levels.title: What is AI and Machine Learning?
levels.description: A high-level overview of the field of Artificial Intelligence.

levels.title: What are Large Language Models (LLMs)?
levels.description: Understand the basics of models like GPT, Gemini, and Claude.

levels.title: The History of LLMs
levels.description: A brief look at the evolution from early models to today's giants.

levels.title: What is Prompt Engineering?
levels.description: Learn why instructing an LLM is a skill in itself.

levels.title: Your First Prompt: Zero-Shot Prompting
levels.description: Ask the model to do something without any examples.

levels.title: The Core Components of a Prompt
levels.description: Understand instruction, context, input data, and output indicator.

levels.title: Clarity and Specificity
levels.description: Learn why being direct and specific is crucial for good results.

levels.title: Assigning a Persona
levels.description: Tell the LLM to act as an expert, a character, or a specific role.

levels.title: Providing Context
levels.description: Give the model relevant information to improve its response.

levels.title: Few-Shot Prompting
levels.description: Provide a few examples of the desired input/output format.

levels.title: Asking for a Specific Format (JSON, Markdown)
levels.description: Instruct the LLM to structure its output in a specific way.

levels.title: Iterative Prompting
levels.description: The process of starting simple and refining your prompt.

levels.title: Common LLM Platforms (Playgrounds)
levels.description: An overview of OpenAI's Playground, Google AI Studio, etc.

levels.title: Temperature and Top-p
levels.description: Control the randomness and creativity of the model's output.

levels.title: Max Length and Stop Sequences
levels.description: Control the length and ending of the model's response.

levels.title: Prompting for Summarization
levels.description: Ask the LLM to summarize long pieces of text.

levels.title: Prompting for Information Extraction
levels.description: Pull specific pieces of information from a text.

levels.title: Prompting for Question Answering
levels.description: Ask questions about a given piece of context.

levels.title: Prompting for Classification
levels.description: Categorize text into predefined groups.

levels.title: Prompting for Creative Writing
levels.description: Use the LLM as a creative partner for writing.

levels.title: Role of Delimiters
levels.description: Use characters like ``` or ### to separate parts of your prompt.

levels.title: The 'Act as' or Persona Pattern
levels.description: A deeper look into making the model adopt a specific role.

levels.title: Zero-Shot vs. One-Shot vs. Few-Shot
levels.description: Understand the difference in providing examples.

levels.title: Hallucinations and How to Spot Them
levels.description: Learn about the tendency of LLMs to make things up.

levels.title: Basic Text Transformation
levels.description: Use prompts to translate, change the tone, or fix grammar.

levels.title: Introduction to Image Generation Prompts
levels.description: Learn the basics of prompting models like Midjourney or DALL-E.

levels.title: Style and Medium Keywords in Image Prompts
levels.description: Learn terms like 'photorealistic', 'oil painting', 'vector art'.

levels.title: Using Negative Prompts
levels.description: Tell the model what you *don't* want to see in the output.

levels.title: Ethical Considerations in Prompting
levels.description: Understand the potential for misuse and how to be a responsible user.

levels.title: Bias in LLMs
levels.description: Learn how biases in training data can appear in model outputs.

levels.title: The Concept of 'Grounding'
levels.description: Provide the model with a source of truth to reduce hallucinations.

levels.title: Asking for Step-by-Step Instructions
levels.description: Prompt the model to break down a complex task.

levels.title: Varying Prompt Length
levels.description: See how the length of your prompt can affect the output.

levels.title: The 'Audience' Pattern
levels.description: Specify the target audience for the model's response (e.g., 'Explain this to a 5-year-old').

levels.title: Prompting for Code Generation
levels.description: Ask the model to write code snippets in various languages.

levels.title: Prompting for Debugging Code
levels.description: Provide code and an error message to get help.

levels.title: Introduction to Prompt Templates
levels.description: Create reusable prompt structures with placeholders.

levels.title: Introduction to APIs
levels.description: Understand how applications can talk to LLMs programmatically.

levels.title: What is a Token?
levels.description: Understand how LLMs 'see' and process text.

levels.title: How LLMs Predict the Next Word
levels.description: A simple explanation of the core mechanic of LLMs.

levels.title: The 'Flipped Interaction' Pattern
levels.description: Have the model ask you questions to better understand your request.

levels.title: Using Analogies in Prompts
levels.description: Help the model understand a concept by comparing it to something else.

levels.title: Specifying Constraints
levels.description: Set rules for the output, such as word count or specific words to include/exclude.

levels.title: Prompting for Tabular Data
levels.description: Ask the model to generate data in a table format.

levels.title: Basic Prompt Chaining
levels.description: Use the output of one prompt as the input for another.

levels.title: Introduction to Embeddings
levels.description: A high-level overview of how text is converted to numbers.

levels.title: Comparing Different Models
levels.description: Understand the strengths and weaknesses of different LLMs.

levels.title: The 'Recipe' Pattern
levels.description: List the steps or ingredients for the model to follow.

levels.title: Prompting for Different Perspectives
levels.description: Ask for arguments for and against a topic.

levels.title: Separating Instruction from Context
levels.description: Best practices for structuring your prompt.

levels.title: The 'Game Play' Pattern
levels.description: Have the LLM simulate a character or scenario.

levels.title: Prompting for Summarization of Different Lengths
levels.description: Ask for a one-sentence summary, a paragraph, or bullet points.

levels.title: Asking for Explanations
levels.description: Prompt the model to explain its reasoning.

levels.title: Introduction to 'System Prompts'
levels.description: Understand the high-level instructions given to a chatbot.

levels.title: What is a 'Jailbreak'?
levels.description: A brief overview of attempts to bypass model safety features.

levels.title: Using Markdown in Prompts
levels.description: Use headings and lists to structure your prompt for the model.

levels.title: Prompting for Brainstorming
levels.description: Use the LLM to generate ideas for a topic.

levels.title: The 'Alternative Approaches' Pattern
levels.description: Ask the model for different ways to solve a problem.

levels.title: Fact-Checking LLM Outputs
levels.description: Learn why you should always verify information from an LLM.

levels.title: Prompting for Rewriting and Paraphrasing
levels.description: Use the LLM to rephrase text.

levels.title: Introduction to Prompt Injection
levels.description: A brief overview of this security vulnerability.

levels.title: The 'Refinement' Pattern
levels.description: Provide text and ask the model to improve it.

levels.title: The 'Template' Pattern
levels.description: Provide a template for the model to fill in.

levels.title: Prompting for FAQs
levels.description: Generate a list of frequently asked questions for a topic.

levels.title: The 'Correction' Pattern
levels.description: Give the model text with errors and ask it to correct them.

levels.title: Image Prompting: Aspect Ratios
levels.description: Learn how to control the dimensions of your generated image.

levels.title: Image Prompting: Camera Angles and Shot Types
levels.description: Use terms like 'wide shot', 'macro', 'cinematic'.

levels.title: The 'Persona' Pattern Revisited
levels.description: Practice writing prompts for different expert personas.

levels.title: Project: Create a Prompt for a Chatbot Persona
levels.description: Write a detailed prompt that defines a chatbot's personality and goals.

levels.title: Project: Build a Few-Shot Prompt for Sentiment Analysis
levels.description: Create a prompt with examples to classify movie reviews.

levels.title: Project: Write a Prompt to Generate a Blog Post Outline
levels.description: Instruct an LLM to create a structured outline for an article.

levels.title: Project: Image Prompt for a Character
levels.description: Write a detailed prompt to generate a consistent character image.

levels.title: Project: A Prompt to Explain a Complex Topic Simply
levels.description: Craft a prompt that explains a difficult concept to a beginner.

levels.title: Final Project: Prompt Engineering for a Business Use Case
levels.description: Choose a business task and create a refined prompt to solve it.

levels.title: Chain-of-Thought (CoT) Prompting
levels.description: Encourage the model to 'think step by step' to solve complex problems.

levels.title: Zero-Shot Chain-of-Thought
levels.description: Trigger step-by-step reasoning without providing examples.

levels.title: Self-Consistency
levels.description: Improve results by sampling multiple CoT paths and taking the majority answer.

levels.title: Generated Knowledge Prompting
levels.description: Have the model first generate facts about a topic, then use those facts to answer.

levels.title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
levels.description: The concept of providing external documents to the model for grounding.

levels.title: Introduction to Vector Databases
levels.description: Understand how RAG systems find relevant information.

levels.title: The 'Chain of Density' Prompting Technique
levels.description: Iteratively make summaries more dense and entity-rich.

levels.title: Prompting for Structured Data Extraction (JSON Schema)
levels.description: Use tools or schemas to force the LLM to output valid JSON.

levels.title: Introduction to LLM Agents
levels.description: The concept of LLMs that can use tools and take actions.

levels.title: ReAct (Reason and Act) Framework
levels.description: Combine chain-of-thought reasoning with action-taking.

levels.title: Prompt Compression Techniques
levels.description: Strategies for fitting more context into the prompt.

levels.title: Evaluating LLM Outputs
levels.description: Learn about metrics like ROUGE and BLEU for evaluating text.

levels.title: Creating Evaluation Datasets
levels.description: Build a set of test cases to measure prompt performance.

levels.title: Automatic Prompt Optimization
levels.description: An overview of techniques that use LLMs to improve prompts.

levels.title: The 'Tree of Thoughts' (ToT) Framework
levels.description: A more advanced method for exploring different reasoning paths.

levels.title: LLM Security: Prompt Injection
levels.description: A deeper dive into how to defend against malicious inputs.

levels.title: LLM Security: Data Leakage
levels.description: Preventing the model from revealing sensitive information.

levels.title: Fine-Tuning vs. Prompt Engineering
levels.description: Understand the trade-offs between the two approaches.

levels.title: Introduction to Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning (PEFT)
levels.description: Learn about techniques like LoRA.

levels.title: The PAL (Program-Aided Language) Model
levels.description: Have the LLM write code to solve problems.

levels.title: Advanced Image Prompting: Weights
levels.description: Emphasize or de-emphasize certain parts of your image prompt.

levels.title: Advanced Image Prompting: Seeds
levels.description: Use seeds to generate consistent images across different prompts.

levels.title: Image-to-Image and Inpainting
levels.description: Use an existing image as a starting point or edit parts of an image.

levels.title: Multi-Modal Prompting
levels.description: Provide both text and images as input to a model.

levels.title: Programmatic Prompt Generation
levels.description: Write code that dynamically builds prompts based on user input.

levels.title: Building a Basic RAG System with an API
levels.description: A conceptual guide to implementing a simple RAG.

levels.title: The 'Reflection' Pattern
levels.description: Have the model critique and improve its own previous output.

levels.title: Structured Output with XML/YAML
levels.description: Prompting the model to generate structured data in different formats.

levels.title: LLM Caching Strategies
levels.description: Save on costs by caching results for common prompts.

levels.title: Tool Use with Function Calling
levels.description: Teach an LLM to use external tools like a calculator or weather API.

levels.title: The role of the System Prompt
levels.description: A deeper dive into setting the model's overall behavior.

levels.title: Contrastive Prompting
levels.description: Provide both a good and a bad example to steer the model.

levels.title: Controlling Tone and Style
levels.description: Techniques for precisely controlling the writing style.

levels.title: The 'Meta-Prompt' Pattern
levels.description: Ask the LLM to generate a good prompt for a given task.

levels.title: Prompt Engineering for Code Translation
levels.description: Translate code from one programming language to another.

levels.title: Prompt Engineering for Data Analysis
levels.description: Ask the model to analyze data and provide insights.

levels.title: Using LLMs for Synthetic Data Generation
levels.description: Create artificial data for training other models.

levels.title: The 'Step Back' Prompting Technique
levels.description: Encourage the model to think about more general concepts first.

levels.title: Dealing with Context Window Limitations
levels.description: Strategies for working with large documents.

levels.title: Prompting for Different Languages
levels.description: Best practices for multilingual prompting.

levels.title: Measuring Prompt Latency and Cost
levels.description: Analyze the performance and cost of your prompts.

levels.title: Active-Prompt: Prompting with Uncertainty
levels.description: A technique that uses uncertainty to select the best few-shot examples.

levels.title: Prompt Engineering for Scientific Research
levels.description: Using LLMs to summarize papers and formulate hypotheses.

levels.title: Prompt Engineering for Education
levels.description: Creating prompts for lesson plans and learning materials.

levels.title: Prompt Engineering for Legal Applications
levels.description: Summarizing legal documents and contracts.

levels.title: The 'Ouroboros' Technique for Prompt Refinement
levels.description: A self-referential loop for improving prompts.

levels.title: Visual Prompting (Click/Box on Image)
levels.description: Interacting with images to specify regions of interest.

levels.title: Red Teaming LLMs
levels.description: Actively trying to find weaknesses and vulnerabilities in a model.

levels.title: The 'Scaffolding' Pattern
levels.description: Break a complex task into smaller, manageable sub-tasks for the LLM.

levels.title: Handling Ambiguity in Prompts
levels.description: Techniques for when a user's request is unclear.

levels.title: The 'Self-Correction' Loop
levels.description: Prompting a model to find and fix its own mistakes.

levels.title: Multi-agent Systems
levels.description: Have multiple LLM agents collaborate to solve a problem.

levels.title: Prompt Management and Versioning
levels.description: Systems for tracking and managing prompts in a large project.

levels.title: Prompt Engineering for Video Generation
levels.description: An introduction to prompting text-to-video models.

levels.title: Prompt Engineering for Audio Generation
levels.description: An introduction to prompting text-to-audio/speech models.

levels.title: Guardrails for LLM Outputs
levels.description: Ensuring model outputs stay on-topic and appropriate.

levels.title: The 'Inception' Prompting Technique
levels.description: Nesting personas or roles within a prompt.

levels.title: The Economics of Prompting
levels.description: Analyzing the trade-offs between prompt complexity, token count, and result quality.

levels.title: Project: Build a Chain-of-Thought Prompt for a Logic Puzzle
levels.description: Craft a prompt that guides an LLM to solve a complex puzzle.

levels.title: Project: Create a ReAct Agent
levels.description: Design a prompt for an agent that can use a simple tool (e.g., a calculator).

levels.title: Project: Optimize a Prompt for Cost and Latency
levels.description: Take a complex prompt and refine it to be more efficient.

levels.title: Project: Build an Evaluation Set for a Task
levels.description: Create a 'golden dataset' to test and compare different prompts.

levels.title: Final Project: Develop a Prompt Library for a Specific Domain
levels.description: Create a collection of highly-engineered prompts for a field like marketing or law.

levels.title: Advanced RAG: Hybrid Search
levels.description: Combine keyword-based search with semantic search for better retrieval.

levels.title: Advanced RAG: Re-ranking
levels.description: Use a second, more powerful model to re-rank the retrieved documents.

levels.title: Graph RAG
levels.description: Retrieve information from knowledge graphs to improve LLM responses.

levels.title: LLM Cascades and Routing
levels.description: Use smaller, faster models for simple tasks and route complex ones to larger models.

levels.title: Tool-Augmented Language Models (TALM)
levels.description: A deep dive into the theory and practice of building tool-using agents.

levels.title: Planning Algorithms for LLM Agents (LLM+P)
levels.description: Use classical planners to help LLMs solve multi-step problems.

levels.title: Memory Systems for LLM Agents
levels.description: Techniques for giving agents short-term and long-term memory.

levels.title: Building Autonomous Agents
levels.description: Design and build agents that can operate with high levels of autonomy.

levels.title: The Future of Prompting: Instruction-Free Models
levels.description: Exploring models that require less explicit instruction.

levels.title: Prompt Engineering for Scientific Discovery
levels.description: Using LLMs to generate hypotheses and design experiments.

levels.title: Constitutional AI
levels.description: Training AI systems to follow a set of principles or a 'constitution'.

levels.title: Advanced Self-Consistency Techniques
levels.description: Beyond majority vote: using model confidence and other signals.

levels.title: Prompt Optimization with Reinforcement Learning
levels.description: Using RL to automatically discover optimal prompt wording.

levels.title: Building Custom Evaluation Metrics
levels.description: Create metrics tailored to your specific use case.

levels.title: Uncertainty Quantification in LLMs
levels.description: How to tell when an LLM is 'not sure' about its answer.

levels.title: The 'EmotionPrompt' Technique
levels.description: Exploring how adding emotional context can influence LLM performance.

levels.title: Prompt Engineering for Multi-Agent Debate
levels.description: Have multiple AI agents debate a topic to find a better solution.

levels.title: Prompt Engineering for Process Automation
levels.description: Create complex chains of prompts to automate business workflows.

levels.title: Stateful LLM Interactions
levels.description: Managing conversation history and state over long interactions.

levels.title: The Business of Prompt Engineering
levels.description: How to create value and build a career as a prompt engineer.

levels.title: Prompt Engineering for AGI
levels.description: Theoretical concepts on how we might instruct future AGI systems.

levels.title: Adversarial Prompting (Red Teaming)
levels.description: A deep dive into techniques for finding model weaknesses.

levels.title: Prompt Forensics
levels.description: Analyzing an output to reverse-engineer the likely prompt.

levels.title: Advanced Function Calling and Tool Creation
levels.description: Design complex tools for LLMs to use.

levels.title: Dynamic Few-Shot Example Selection
levels.description: Programmatically choose the most relevant examples for a given query.

levels.title: Fine-Tuning a Model vs. Engineering a Mega-Prompt
levels.description: A cost-benefit analysis for specific use cases.

levels.title: Cross-Modal Prompting
levels.description: Use a text prompt to edit an image, or an image to guide text generation.

levels.title: Differential Privacy in Prompts
levels.description: Techniques for querying data without revealing private information.

levels.title: Structured State Spaces for LLM Planning
levels.description: Formal methods for guiding agentic behavior.

levels.title: Interpretability of LLM Decisions
levels.description: Advanced techniques for understanding *why* an LLM gives a certain response.

levels.title: Leading a Prompt Engineering Team
levels.description: Managing projects, standards, and a team of prompt engineers.

levels.title: Building a Prompt Library as a Product
levels.description: The architecture and business model for selling access to prompts.

levels.title: Multi-Lingual Prompt Adaptation
levels.description: Techniques for translating and adapting prompts across languages.

levels.title: Prompting for Domain-Specific Languages (DSLs)
levels.description: Have the LLM generate code in a highly specialized language.

levels.title: The 'Analogical Prompting' Technique
levels.description: A structured way to have the model generate its own examples before solving.

levels.title: Automated LLM Evaluation Frameworks
levels.description: Build systems to continuously test and evaluate your prompts.

levels.title: Calibrating LLM Output Probabilities
levels.description: Make the model's confidence scores more reliable.

levels.title: Final Project: Build a Fully Autonomous Research Agent
levels.description: Create an agent that can research a topic, synthesize findings, and write a report.

levels.title: Final Project: Create a Novel Prompting Technique
levels.description: Develop and document a new, effective prompting strategy.

levels.title: Final Project: Win a Prompt Engineering Competition
levels.description: Compete and place in a public prompt engineering contest.

levels.title: The 'Chain of Verification' Method
levels.description: Reduce hallucinations by having the model verify its own facts.

levels.title: Advanced RAG: Recursive Retrieval and Query Transformation
levels.description: Break down complex questions into sub-questions for better retrieval.

levels.title: Self-Rewarding Language Models
levels.description: Models that can generate their own rewards for fine-tuning.

levels.title: LLM Watermarking and Provenance
levels.description: Techniques for identifying AI-generated text.

levels.title: Efficient LLM Serving (vLLM, TensorRT-LLM)
levels.description: Understand the infrastructure for deploying LLMs at scale.

levels.title: Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) Models
levels.description: The architecture behind models like Mixtral.

levels.title: Optimizing Multi-Turn Conversations
levels.description: Strategies for maintaining context and coherence in long chats.

levels.title: The Psychology of Human-AI Interaction
levels.description: How users perceive and interact with LLMs.

levels.title: Designing prompts for 'AI Tutors'
levels.description: Create educational experiences with Socratic prompting.

levels.title: Designing prompts for 'AI Therapists'
levels.description: The ethics and techniques for mental health applications.

levels.title: The Future of AI Interfaces
levels.description: Moving beyond the text box.

levels.title: Leading AI Alignment Research
levels.description: An overview of the key problems in AI safety.

levels.title: Presenting to Executive Leadership on AI Strategy
levels.description: Communicating the value and risk of LLMs to business leaders.

levels.title: Mock Interview: Prompt Engineering Case Study
levels.description: Solve a complex, real-world prompt engineering problem.

levels.title: Mock Interview: LLM System Design
levels.description: Design an end-to-end application powered by LLMs.

levels.title: Mock Interview: Red Teaming Exercise
levels.description: Be tasked with finding flaws in a deployed LLM system.

levels.title: Capstone: Build a Production-Grade LLM Agent
levels.description: Create a robust, tool-using agent with memory and planning capabilities.

levels.title: Capstone: Publish a Paper on a Prompting Technique
levels.description: Conduct novel research and write it up for a workshop or conference.

levels.title: Capstone: Consult for a Real Business
levels.description: Work with a real company to solve a business problem using prompt engineering.

levels.title: Advanced Multi-Agent Systems
levels.description: Simulating complex systems (e.g., an economy) with AI agents.

levels.title: World Models and Predictive AI
levels.description: Training agents that can predict the future states of their environment.

levels.title: The 'Tool-Chain' Pattern
levels.description: Sequencing multiple tools and models to achieve a complex goal.

levels.title: Formal Verification of Prompts
levels.description: Mathematically proving that a prompt will behave as expected.

levels.title: The 'Cognitive Architecture' Pattern
levels.description: Designing prompts that mimic human cognitive processes.

levels.title: Long Context Models
levels.description: Techniques for effectively using models with million-token context windows.

levels.title: Prompt Engineering for Codebases
levels.description: Using LLMs to understand, refactor, and document large codebases.

levels.title: The Ethics of Autonomous Agents
levels.description: The philosophical and practical challenges of deploying autonomous systems.

levels.title: The Future of Human-Computer Interaction with AI
levels.description: Beyond text: exploring voice, gesture, and BCI.

levels.title: Capstone: Develop a new evaluation benchmark
levels.description: Create a new benchmark for testing a specific LLM capability.

levels.title: Capstone: Build a prompt optimization service
levels.description: Create a tool that automatically improves user prompts.

levels.title: Capstone: A/B Testing Live Prompts
levels.description: Design and run a live experiment to compare two prompts in a production system.
